title: Dynamic Correlation of Market Connectivity, Risk Spillover and Abnormal Volatility in Stock Price
abstract: arXiv:2403.19363v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: The connectivity of stock markets reflects the information efficiency of capital markets and contributes to interior risk contagion and spillover effects. We compare Shanghai Stock Exchange A-shares (SSE A-shares) during tranquil periods, with high leverage periods associated with the 2015 subprime mortgage crisis. We use Pearson correlations of returns, the maximum strongly connected subgraph, and $3\sigma$ principle to iteratively determine the threshold value for building a dynamic correlation network of SSE A-shares. Analyses are carried out based on the networking structure, intra-sector connectivity, and node status, identifying several contributions. First, compared with tranquil periods, the SSE A-shares network experiences a more significant small-world and connective effect during the subprime mortgage crisis and the high leverage period in 2015. translated_title: 股市连接性、风险溢出和股价异常波动的动态相关性
translated_abstract: 股市的连接性反映了资本市场的信息效率，对内部风险传染和溢出效应产生影响。我们比较了上海证券交易所A股在宁静时期与与2015年次贷危机相关的高杠杆时期的情况。我们使用收益的Pearson相关系数、最大强连接子图和$3\sigma$原则来迭代确定构建SSE A股动态相关网络的阈值。基于网络结构、行业内连通性和节点状态进行分析，得出几点贡献。首先，与宁静时期相比，SSE A股网络在次贷危机和2015年高杠杆期间经历了更显著的小世界和连接效应。其次，金融业、能源和公用事业等行业具有更强的行业内连通性。
tldr: 分析了上海证券交易所A股在次贷危机和高杠杆时期的动态相关网络，发现与宁静时期相比，SSE A股网络在危机期间表现出更显著的小世界和连接效应，并且金融业、能源和公用事业等行业具有更强的行业内连通性。
en_tdlr: Analyzed the dynamic correlation network of Shanghai Stock Exchange A-shares during the subprime mortgage crisis and high leverage period, finding that compared with tranquil periods, the SSE A-shares network showed more significant small-world and connectivity effects during the crisis, with stronger intra-industry connectivity in finance, energy, and utilities sectors.
